title: Grealish has a point to prove with England
shortDescription: The race for World Cup roles ramps up this week. Jack Grealish has strong competition for an England starting spot and must kick on after slow start at Man City.

title: Former Ballon d'Or winner Hegerberg ends five-year Norway exile
shortDescription: Ada Hegerberg returned to the Norway squad for the first time in five years on Thursday, handing a huge boost to the team ahead of this year's European Championship.

title: Keillor-Dunn: Oldham relishing survival bid under Sheridan
shortDescription: Oldham's Davis Keillor-Dunn on believing in his ability, learning in the face of adversity and John Sheridan's impact on his return for a sixth spell at Boundary Park.

title: Man Utd 'must convince' Ten Hag | 'Sizeable leap' for Ajax boss
shortDescription: Manchester United face competition from two major European clubs for the services of Ajax manager Erik ten Hag, according to Dutch football expert Marcel van der Kraan.

title: Russia & Turkey rival UK-Ireland for Euro 2028 | Russia suspension coming?
shortDescription: Despite their current ban by FIFA and UEFA, Russia have joined the UK and Ireland in declaring an interest to host Euro 2028, with Turkey also in the running.

title: Bale: All my attention & focus on Austria play-off | 'Experience can help us'
shortDescription: Gareth Bale says all of his "attention and focus" is on Wales' World Cup play-off against Austria on Thursday, live on Sky Sports, and past experience can help his side.

title: Two PL clubs in touch with Pogba | 'With Man Utd or elsewhere, I want trophies'
shortDescription: Paul Pogba is attracting plenty of interest with Premier League clubs among those keen on his services as his contract at Manchester United winds down this summer.

title: Man Utd hold 'positive' talks with Ajax boss Ten Hag
shortDescription: Manchester United held "positive" talks with Erik ten Hag on Monday - with the club hierarchy thought to be impressed by his vision and philosophy.

title: Bale and Ramsey: Are the Wales engines ready to motor?
shortDescription: Wales’ pair of Lamborghinis - Gareth Bale and Aaron Ramsey - have been left parked in the garage. Will their engines roar when unleashed in Cardiff?

title: Wales bidding to end 64 years of World Cup hurt
shortDescription: Wales are just two victories away from qualifying for their first World Cup finals since 1958. Watch their play-off with Austria live on Sky Sports.

title: Papers: Villa, Newcastle target Pogba, Juventus want Martial
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Thursday's national newspapers...

title: Chelsea licence now allows ticket sales | Club has access to £30m fund
shortDescription: Amendments have been made to Chelsea's licence, meaning fans are able to purchase tickets and the club have access to a £30m fund via their parent company.

title: Arsenal rescue draw in CL | Eidevall: 100 per cent we'll win
shortDescription: Lotte Wubben-Moy's last-gasp strike rescued Arsenal a 1-1 draw against Wolfsburg in the Women's Champions League quarter-final first leg at the Emirates Stadium.

title: WSL: Man City see off Everton with another 4-0 win
shortDescription: Manchester City Women moved level on points with third-placed Manchester United after a 4-0 Women's Super League victory over Everton Women.

title: Rogic doubtful for Old Firm | Sakala tests positive for Covid
shortDescription: Celtic's Tom Rogic could miss next weekend's Old Firm after suffering an injury against Ross County while Rangers' Fashion Sakala has tested positive for Covid.

title: Chelsea's key WSL match against Tottenham postponed
shortDescription: Chelsea Women's key Women's Super League clash against Tottenham Women on Wednesday night was postponed due to a Covid outbreak in the Spurs squad.

title: Gary Neville on 25-man shortlist for Premier League Hall of Fame
shortDescription: The Premier League has announced a shortlist of 25 former players who are eligible to join its Hall of Fame in 2022, with Sky Sports' Gary Neville among the nominees.

title: Kane: England players discussing Qatar statement
shortDescription: Harry Kane says England's players will use their platform at the World Cup to try to improve human rights issues in Qatar.

title: Bale 'ready' for Wales' World Cup play-off | 'Biggest game I've played in'
shortDescription: Gareth Bale has trained with Wales ahead of Thursday's World Cup play-off with Austria in a major boost to Rob Page's side.

title: Two PL clubs monitor Rudiger as Juve lodge interest
shortDescription: Two Premier League clubs are monitoring Antonio Rudiger's contract situation as Juventus firm up their interest in the Chelsea defender.
